en.label:
Randomization helps reduce bias and improve data quality by changing the order of pages, questions, or options. Sampling ensures a fair distribution—especially useful when you want to test variations or shorten response time.


In this demo, you’ll see different ways to apply these techniques with Qlarr.
Welcome to Qlarr's Randomization and Sampling survey demo!
Out of the next 3 pages, 2 will be randomly selected and shown in a random order each time you refresh the survey.
en.description: You can use this when testing different flows or A/B variations.

en.label: Step 1: Click on the "puzzle" icon at the bottom right of your screen to open additional customization settings.
Step 2: click on Theme, and move to the menu on the left to expand the Order and Priority menu. It should be set to the default settings like the image below:
Step 3: In order to randomize only 3 specific pages out of the survey, select Custom under Groups Order, and then add a new random rule by selecting the 3 pages in mind.
en.description: This ensures the randomization only applies to the selected pages of the survey. You can also choose from other options like randomizing all or flipping the order.

en.label: Step 4: To show only 2 out of the 3 pages, you need to then select Prioritize Groups under the Groups Priority menu, and add a priority rule to show "2" out of the 3 selected pages.
en.description: Note in the image below how you can adjust the number of items to show, as well as the priority for each item.

en.label: From the 3 questions below, 2 will be randomly selected and shuffled on every load.
en.description: Great for question order bias reduction or trimming long surveys without losing variety.

en.label: Step 1: click on the "gear" icon at the top right of the page where you want to randomize questions, and then go to the Order and Priority menu.
Step 2: Under the Questions Order menu, select Random Order.
en.description: This will randomize all the questions on this specific page.

en.label: Step 3: Select Prioritize Questions under the Questions Priority menu, and add a priority rule to show 2 out of the 3 questions on the page.
en.description: Note how you can adjust the priority for each question when creating the priority rule.

en.label: Qlarr gives you flexible control over how answer options are displayed. You can fully shuffle them, flip the order of scales, sort alphabetically, or randomize rows and columns in arrays. Even image and icon choices can be randomized—and when needed, you can lock certain options in place.
3.4 Array Questions
en.description: You can randomize both rows and columns

en.label: 3.6 Partial Randomization
en.description: Lock certain options in place (e.g. always show “Other” last)

instructionList.text: (!Q19.in_current_navigation || !Q19.relevance || Q19.validity) && (!Q20.in_current_navigation || !Q20.relevance || Q20.validity) && (!Q21.in_current_navigation || !Q21.relevance || Q21.validity) && (!Q22.in_current_navigation || !Q22.relevance || Q22.validity) && (!Q23.in_current_navigation || !Q23.relevance || Q23.validity) && (!Q24.in_current_navigation || !Q24.relevance || Q24.validity)

en.label: Step 1: Click on the "gear" icon at the top right of the question you want to randomize, and then go to the Order and Priority menu.
Step 2: Under the Options Order menu, select how you would like to randomize your options.
en.description: This applies to any type of question you wish to randomize the options for.

en.label: ... select Custom if you wish to apply partial randomization, and fix certain options in place, like in example 3.6 above.
Step 3: The Options Priority menu allows you to create different priority rules for options within a question.
... depending on the question type, Qlarr’s ordering and prioritization settings let you customize how content is displayed.
en.description: Like randomizing rows and columns in array questions

en.label: These tools help you keep surveys dynamic, reduce order bias, and improve overall data quality.
Ready to try building your own randomized survey? Just head to the builder and explore the different settings in any question or page!
Thank you for checking out Qlarr's Randomization and Sampling demo!
